info.title: Hagbad Online REST API
info.description:
# Introduction

The Hagbad REST API is a RESTFul API built on HTTP. It provides the following features:
- Predictable resource URLs. 
- Accepts and returns JSON in the HTTP body. 
- Returns HTTP response codes to indicate errors. 
- You can use your favorite HTTP/REST library for your programming language to use Hagbad’s APIs.

# Who we are? 

Grey Systems is a well establish European IT Consulting company that specialises in working with financial institutions.
During the last years, we have developed "Hagbad Platform", a next level technology platform to provide online multichannel MoneyPool services to Payment Institutions, MSB, Banks, etc.

# Goal 

The goal of this technical documentation is providing to Front-End developers (Mobile, Web, …) the specifications to connect to Hagbad System Platform though the APIs exposed in its gateway.
This means that the API is intended to by used directly by the Front End, so all the operations assume that a customer is logged in the system, and will provide information based on that assumption.


# Authentication


## The identity endpoint
Several resources exposed by this gateway are secured, and you will need a [json web token](https://jwt.io/) to reach the secured methods.

The main way to get this jwt should be the Oauth2 flow method called `Authorization Code`. The Oauth2 flow has become the web security standard in the internet services.
You can get more information about Oauth2 framework here:
https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6749

You can use our Hagbad identity manager that follows the oauth2 standard. All the requests made against `/auth` endpoint will be automatically redirected to the Hagbad identity manager. This identity manager knows every configured partner in the Hagbad system and is capable of authenticating and registering users using the partner system's own configuration.

The related project that builds and configures the Hagbad identity manager is: https://gitlab.com/grey-systems/hagbad/hagbad-identity. (Please, note that you will need an authorized user to see this repository)

Now, let's see the allowed methods exposed under the `/auth` path:

### Well known endpoint
The well known endpoint provides you all the Oauth2 configuration that you ought to know to build the oauth flow in your application.
This endpoint returns, among other information, where the authorization or token endpoint is published. Also describe the allowed scopes and the public key made by the identity manager.

Let's see an example request using the develop environment gateway.

`GET http://localhost:8080/auth/realms/aqil/.well-known/openid-configuration`

### Obtaining the Authorization Code
Once you know how to configure the oauth flow, you can get the authorization code to start the user authentication.

As we can see in the official documentation described above: 

>The authorization code is obtained by using an authorization server
as an intermediary between the client and resource owner.  Instead of
requesting authorization directly from the resource owner, the client
directs the resource owner to an authorization server (via its
user-agent as defined in [RFC2616]), which in turn directs the
resource owner back to the client with the authorization code.

You will need an internet browser to start the get Authorization Code flow. The browser is required because the identity manager
will redirect the authorization request to the proper partner (currently, one test partner built using oauth0 application). The 
partner will request you the user and password and validate them. If the authorization is success, the identity
manager will return to you (where the redirect_uri indicates) the authorization code that you will use
to request the `access_token` via the token endpoint.

Let's see an example (remember, this request will be launched inside the browser):

```json
http://localhost:8080/auth/realms/aqil/protocol/openid-connect/auth?redirect_uri=http://localhost:8081&client_id=aqil-api-client&response_type=code&scope=openid
```
Now, you should see the oauth2 auth form:

![oauth form](.images/authorizations/oauth2-auth-form.png)

Login with an existent user and you will be redirected to the registration page if the user does not already exist in the system:
![partner registration page](.images/authorizations/aqil-registration-page.png)

Type the required fields and click in the register button. Please, keep in mind that the authorization code will be returned to `http://localhost:8081` so, you will need to capture the response using the browser developer tools:

![authorization code intercepted](.images/authorizations/authorization-code-intercepted.png)

Now, you can use the provided authorization code to get the `access_token`. You will send a POST request to the token endpoint:

```bash
curl --request POST \
  --url http://localhost:8080/auth/realms/aqil/protocol/openid-connect/token \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' \
  --data grant_type=authorization_code \
  --data code=f3e31822-73d0-484c-91d4-7839ab72c75f.379adde7-0448-4764-ae99-cf0852755e5e.5fdbcc2d-44a0-45d0-9ac7-1c423f622f0f \
  --data client_id=aqil-api-client \
  --data client_secret=e33009fc-17a6-4549-8bd6-b1a82792444b \
  --data redirect_uri=http://localhost:8081
```

Obtaining this response:

![access token](.images/authorizations/access_token.png)

**Getting service access_token via HTTP graphical client**

If you are using HTTP clients like Insomnia, you can integrate this authorization code as part as the request authentication. Getting the `access_token` in a pretty easy way. Just add the `Authorization Code` option in the authorization tab and rock and roll:

![Insomnia authorization](.images/authorizations/insomnia-authorization.png)

## Refreshing the access token
The access tokens given by the identity manager have expiration time. If you `access token` is expired, you will refresh it using the token endpoint provides by the identity manager.

In a similar way that you get the `access token` in the last step described in the previous point, you can refresh the token making a POST request to the token endpoint:

```bash
curl --request POST \
  --url http://localhost:8080/auth/realms/aqil/protocol/openid-connect/token \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' \
  --data grant_type=refresh_token \
  --data refresh_token=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCIgOiAiSldUIiwia2lkIiA6ICJkZTNjYWU2NC0wMGQ3LTQ4NTEtYWQ2ZS1lMmQ3ZTZjN2ZhMmUifQ.._EnQzlqqHSZNQYx5Va_ifcsN1LCL_DKMkmVluIgAxao \
  --data client_id=aqil-api-client \
  --data client_secret=e33009fc-17a6-4549-8bd6-b1a82792444b
```

Please, note that in this POST request, the `grant_type` is `refresh_token` instead of `authorization_code`. 

The refresh response is the same that you receive when get the `access_token` in the previous step. Using this mechanism, you can refresh the `access_token as time as you need.

## Getting the user info
The identity manager provides the oauth2 endpoint `/userinfo`. You can use this endpoint to get the very basic user information saved in the identity manager. This method is not recommended getting the user info due to it contains only the public information about the user, ignoring more specific fields that maybe you need.

To get the user info, simply use `GET http://localhost:8080/auth/realms/aqil/protocol/openid-connect/userinfo` giving the bearer token in the `Authorization` header. 

Here is the response for the user registered above:

![user info](.images/authorizations/user-info.png)

## Logout the current user session
Each time you get an `access_token`, you are creating a new session in the identity manager. If you want to logout the current session of the user, you just use the `/logout` endpoint provides by the identity manager.

Use: `GET http://localhost:8080/auth/realms/aqil/protocol/openid-connect/logout` with the bearer token in the `Authorization` header to logout the related


# Common HTTP Error Responses

The HAGBAD Rest API uses the following common HTTP status codes to communicate general issues or errors to the clients: 

* HTTP **400** (Invalid Request): The request provided is invalid (request is not well formed, a mandatory field is not provided, etc..). 
* HTTP **404** (Not found): The searched item could not be found (the moneypool was not found, etc..). 
* HTTP **409** (Conflict): There is a conflict when trying to execute the operation (status change not allowed, etc..). 
* HTTP **500** (Internal Server Error): Some internal component has failed to process your request. Please notify about this error to GreySystems team.

get.description: Get the entire list of countries.

200.description: Returns a list with the countries.

400.description: Invalid parameters, response contains detailed error.

get.description: Returns the country by iso code 3.

200.description: Returns the details of a country.

400.description: Invalid parameters, response contains detailed error.

get.summary: Get city by iso code 3 (search cities).
get.description: Returns a list of cities, filtering the cities by the name passed by parameters. The name must be at least three characters.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: City name, minimum length three characters.

200.description: Returns a list with the cities.

400.description: Invalid parameters, response contains detailed error.

get.description: Returns a city by its id.

200.description: Returns a city by its id.

400.description: Invalid parameters, response contains detailed error.

get.summary: Get states by iso code 3 (search states).
get.description: Returns a list of states, filtering the states by iso code 3 and name (optional) passed by parameters.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: State name, minimum length three characters. If this parameter is not informed, it will return all available states in the country.

200.description: Returns a list with the states.

400.description: Invalid parameters, response contains detailed error.

get.description: Returns a state by its id.

200.description: Returns a state by its id.

400.description: Invalid parameters, response contains detailed error.

get.description: Get the entire list of currencies.

200.description: Returns a list with the currencies.

400.description: Invalid parameters, response contains detailed error.

get.description: Returns the currency by iso code.

200.description: Returns the details of a currency.

400.description: Invalid parameters, response contains detailed error.

200.description: Partner successfully selected, return current configuration.

post.description:
The HostID field which is necessary to inform when creating a pool will be provided by the architecture.
 </br> </br> 
This save service will cover the update functionality too. If the moneypool id field in the request body is informed it will be an update behaviour, if it isn’t a create one.

400.description: Invalid Request. message attribute of response contains detailed information about the issue.

404.description: The moneypool to update could not be found. Edit a pool in which you aren’t the Host.

409.description: Conflict :Update a  locked / started / finished pool

get.summary: Get a moneypool by its id.
get.description: Get all the information about a single moneypool.

200.description: Returns a Moneypool and its details.

400.description: Invalid parameters, response contains detailed error

404.description: Moneypool has not been found using the id provided as request parameter.

get.description: Recover a moneypool for your community.

200.description: Returns a Moneypool and its details.

400.description: Invalid parameters, response contains detailed error

404.description: Moneypool has not been found using the id provided as request parameter.

post.description:
Search moneypools given some parameters.

When filling the required params, if you inform the poolCode it isn’t necessary to inform the startDate fields and vice versa.

200.description: Find one or more Moneypools matching with the search parameters. Not find any Moneypools matching with the search parameters (empty array).

400.description: Invalid parameters, response contains detailed error

put.description: Update the status of a given moneypool.

200.description: Moneypool successfully updated.

400.description: Invalid parameters, response contains detailed error

404.description: The moneypool to update could not be found. Edit a pool in which you aren’t the Host.

get.description: Get the movements of a Moneypool.

200.description: Returns the balance movements of the given Moneypool. Returns an empty list if the money pool doesn’t have movements yet.

400.description: Invalid parameters, response contains detailed error

404.description: Moneypool has not been found using the id provided as request parameter.

get.description: Get all members of the Moneypool community.

200.description: Returns the members of the given Moneypool. Returns an empty list if the money pool doesn’t have members yet.

400.description: Invalid parameters, response contains detailed error

404.description: Moneypool has not been found using the id provided as request parameter.

post.description: Add a member to the Moneypool. It will be used to Join the moneypool as a member (when the Moneypool is public).

200.description: Member successfully added.

400.description: Invalid parameters, response contains detailed error

404.description: Moneypool has not been found using the id provided as request parameter.

delete.description: Expel a member from a moneypool.

parameters.name: memberId
parameters.description: The id of the member we want to delete from the moneypool.

200.description: Member successfully removed from the moneypool.

400.description: Invalid parameters, response contains detailed error

404.description: Moneypool has not been found using the id provided as request parameter. Member has not been found using the id provided as request parameter.

put.description: Update the position of  a member in a moneypool.

parameters.name: memberId
parameters.description: The id of the member we want to delete from the moneypool.

parameters.name: positionFrom
parameters.description: The position currently occupied by the member.

parameters.name: positionTo
parameters.description: The position that the member should occupy.

200.description: Member successfully update from the moneypool.

400.description: Invalid parameters, response contains detailed error

404.description: Moneypool has not been found using the id provided as request parameter. Member has not been found using the id provided as request parameter.

409.description: The moneypool cannot be edited in the current state..

put.description: Delete the position of  a member in a moneypool.

parameters.name: memberId
parameters.description: The id of the member we want to delete from the moneypool.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The position occupied by the member.

200.description: Member successfully delete from the pool.

400.description: Invalid parameters, response contains detailed error

404.description: Moneypool has not been found using the id provided as request parameter. Member has not been found using the id provided as request parameter.

409.description: The moneypool cannot be edited in the current state..

post.description: Invites a customer to join the moneypool.

400.description: Invalid parameters, response contains detailed error.

404.description: Moneypool has not been found using the id provided as request parameter. Customer has not been found using the id provided as request parameter.

get.description: Return a list with all the invitations of a customer given his identifier.

200.description: Returns the invitation list. Returns empty list if there is none.

400.description: Invalid customer identifier format, response contains detailed error.

get.description: Return a list with all the invitations of a moneypool given his identifier.

200.description: Returns the invitation list. Returns empty list if there is none.

400.description: Invalid moneypool identifier format, response contains detailed error.

put.description: Accept the invitation given its identifier.

200.description: Invitation successfully accepted.

400.description: Invalid invitation identifier format, response contains detailed error.

put.description: Decline the invitation given its identifier.

200.description: Returns the invitation list. Returns empty list if there is none.

400.description: Invalid invitation identifier format, response contains detailed error.

post.description: The customer request to join a moneypool.

400.description: Invalid parameters, response contains detailed error.

404.description: Moneypool has not been found using the id provided as request parameter. Customer has not been found using the id provided as request parameter.

get.description: Return a list with all the joining requests of a customer given his identifier.

200.description: Returns the joining requests list. Returns empty list if there is none.

400.description: Invalid customer identifier format, response contains detailed error.

get.description: Return a list with all the joining requests of a moneypool given his identifier.

200.description: Returns the joining requests list. Returns empty list if there is none.

400.description: Invalid moneypool identifier format, response contains detailed error.

put.description: Accept the joining request given its identifier.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The identifier of the joining request.

200.description: Joining request successfully accepted.

400.description: Invalid joining request identifier format, response contains detailed error.

put.description: Decline the joining request given its identifier.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The identifier of the joining request.

200.description: Joining request successfully declined.

400.description: Invalid joining request identifier format, response contains detailed error.

iso2.description: Alphanumeric iso code (2-letters) of the country.

iso3.description: Alphanumeric iso code (3-letters) of the country.

name.description: Name of the city (locale based). Will return non-ascii characters for those cities that are originally written using non-latin alphabet.

nameAscii.description: Name of the city (using ascii characters, for english readers).

name.description: Name of the state (locale based). Will return non-ascii characters for those states that are originally written using non-latin alphabet.

nameAscii.description: Name of the state (using ascii characters, for english readers).

iso.description: Alphanumeric iso code (3-letters) of the currency.

minMembers.description: The minimum number of members a community can have for this partner.

maxMembers.description: The maximum number of members a community can have for this partner.

paymentMethods.description: The different payment methods configured for this partner.

id.description: Moneypool id. It is only required to update a moneypool.

amountToSave.description: Amount which every Moneypool component will receive in his collect turn.

paymentsFrequency.description: Frequency of the payments (MONTHLY / BIMONTHLY / BIWEEKLY).

amountToSave.description: Amount which every Moneypool component will receive in his collect turn.

paymentsFrequency.description: Frequency of the payments (MONTHLY / BIMONTHLY / BIWEEKLY).

amountToSave.description: Amount which every Moneypool component will receive in his collect turn.

paymentsFrequency.description: Frequency of the payments (MONTHLY / BIMONTHLY / BIWEEKLY).

status.description: Status of the Moneypool (OPENED / CANCELLED / LOCKED / STARTED / FINISHED).

amountToSave.description: Amount which every Moneypool component will receive in his collect turn.

paymentsFrequency.description: Frequency of the payments (MONTHLY / BIMONTHLY / BIWEEKLY).

customerId.description: The identifier of the customer we want to add to the pool.

position.description: Position the member will take in the moneypool.

moneypoolId.description: The identifier of the moneypool the customer will be invited to.

customerId.description: The identifier of the customer we want to invite.

position.description: Position the customer will take in the moneypool.

moneypoolId.description: The id of the moneypool the customer is requesting to join.

customerId.description: The identifier of the customer who is doing the request.

position.description: Position the customer will take in the moneypool.

moneypoolId.description: The moneypool identifier the customer is invited to.
The moneypool identifier the customer is requesting to join.

customerId.description: The customer who request to join identifier.

JWT.description: You can obtain a JSON Web Token (`access_token`), using our OpenID Connect Authorizations Server
JWT.name: Authorization: Bearer access_token
